questions.question: Let A={1,2,3,4,6,24,36,72}, Let ≤ be the partial order defined by A≤B if a divides b. Number of edges in the Hasse diagram of (A,≤) is

explanations.a: A hasse diagram is a graphical rendering of partial order set displayed via the cover realtion of the partial ordered set with an implied upward direction, here the number of hasse edges are 11
explanations.b: A hasse diagram is a graphical rendering of partial order set displayed via the cover realtion of the partial ordered set with an implied upward direction, here the number of hasse edges are 11
explanations.c: A hasse diagram is a graphical rendering of partial order set displayed via the cover realtion of the partial ordered set with an implied upward direction, here the number of hasse edges are 11
explanations.d: A hasse diagram is a graphical rendering of partial order set displayed via the cover realtion of the partial ordered set with an implied upward direction, here the number of hasse edges are 11

questions.question: If A = {1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18], then number of edges in the poset diagram of poset [A; /] is
Which of the following are one of the maximal and minimal elements respectively of the poset ({2,4,5,10,12,20},/)

explanations.a: Maximal elemets are {12,20} and the minimal elements are {2,5} therefore 12 ,2 is correct
explanations.b: Maximal elemets are {12,20} and the minimal elements are {2,5} therefore 10 ,2 is wrong
explanations.c: Maximal elemets are {12,20} and the minimal elements are {2,5} therefore 5,2 is wrong
explanations.d: Maximal elemets are {12,20} and the minimal elements are {2,5} therefore 10,5 is wrong

questions.question: Which of the following is/are neither a maximal element nor a minimal element of the  poset ({1,2,3,4,5,6},/)?

explanations.a: 4 is maximal element since it will not succeeded by another element in Hasse diagram
explanations.b: 2 and 3 are neither maximal nor minimal because they are preceded and succeeded by other elements
explanations.c: 2 and 3 are neither maximal nor minimal because they are preceded and succeeded by other elements

questions.question: Let P be the set of all people. Let R be a binary relation on P such that (a, b) is in R if a is a brother of b. Is R symmetric, transitive, an equivalence relation, a partial order relation?

explanations.d: R is Transitive not equivalence relation
